choices.A: Data can be lost when converting from auto-number to text.
choices.B: Data can be lost converting from number to currency (assuming that field lengths are identical).
choices.D: Information can be lost when converting from text area (rich) to text area (long).

discussion.content:
A B

"You can convert rich text area fields into long text area fields only. Any images get deleted the next time you save the long text area field. "

discussion.content:
Correct Answer is A&D
1. If you convert an auto-number field into a text field, the data in that field remains unchanged.
2. You can only convert rich text area fields into long text area fields. Any images are deleted the next time the long text area field is saved. After converting, markup is hidden in the long text area field but it is not removed from the record until you save the record. That way, the markup can be restored if you change your mind.

Changing to Picklist (Multi-Select) from any other type
Currently defined picklist values are retained when you change a picklist to a multi-select picklist.
B,D correct answers
Changing to Currency from any other type can cause loss of data
You can only convert rich text area fields into long text area fields. Any images are deleted the next time the long text area field is saved.

If you convert an auto-number field into a text field, the data in that field remains unchanged. Also, you can safely convert a text custom field into an auto-number field without losing your data. Converting an auto-number field into any other data type results in data loss.
Good answer is A,D
